title: US hails ‘tremendous progress’ at Ukraine peace talks
byline: A “tremendous amount of progress” has been achieved in talks to finalise a US-proposed peace plan to end the Russia-Ukraine war, Secretary of State Marco Rubio has said.

title: One dead, 3 injured after tree falls on three-wheeler in Rambukkana
byline: One person has been confirmed dead following an incident in which a large tree fell onto a three-wheeler travelling through the Talagolla area along the Mawanella–Rambukkana road last night (23).

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance in the vicinity of Sri Lanka is likely to develop into a low pressure system by tomorrow (25). Therefore, the prevailing showery conditions over the island are expected to continue during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Commuters can pay bus fares using bank cards starting today
byline: Commuters will be able to pay bus fares using bank-issued credit and debit cards on buses equipped with ticket-issuing machines with effect from today (25), the Ministry of Transport announced.

title: Australia’s teen social media ban pushes content creators to look abroad
byline: Australia is home for YouTube star Jordan Barclay, the place where he was born, went to school and built a company worth $50 million by age 23 that produces gaming content for 23 million subscribers.

title: President Dissanayake celebrates 57th birthday today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, the 9th Executive President of Sri Lanka, celebrates his 57th birthday today, November 24.

title: Agrarian Insurance Board unveils pension scheme offering multiple benefits to fishermen
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board has introduced a new Fishermen’s Pension Scheme aimed at providing enhanced social security and financial benefits to members of the fishing community.

title: UAE expresses solidarity with Sri Lanka over victims of landslide
byline: The UAE said it stands in solidarity with Sri Lanka over the victims of the landslide in the central province that killed at least four on Saturday.

title: Vimukthi Jayasundara’s ‘Spying Stars’ premieres at IFFI 2025
byline: Following its world premiere at the Busan International Film Festival, acclaimed Sri Lankan filmmaker Vimukthi Jayasundara’s latest feature, Spying Stars, received its Indian premiere with a Red-Carpet Gala Screening at the 56th International Film Festival of India (IFFI) on 22 November 2025.

title: PM Harini and US Ambassador discuss bilateral educational cooperation
byline: US Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, has met with the Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, at the Parliament of Sri Lanka.

title: Man arrested for illegal excavation of artifacts in Thanamalwila
byline: A person who was involved in illegal excavation of artifacts has been arrested in the Batuwewa area of Thanamalwila.

title: Gunmen attack Pakistan paramilitary force headquarters, police say
byline: Gunmen attacked a paramilitary force headquarters in Pakistan’s northwestern city of Peshawar on Monday, police said.

title: Suspect arrested for providing lodging to gunmen plotting to kill businessman and 6 others in Midigama
byline: A suspect allegedly involved in a attempt to kill seven people, including a businessman, in the Midigama area has been arrested.

title: Bus fare payment service using bank cards officially launched
byline: The bus fare payment service using bank-issued credit and debit cards was officially launched this morning (24) at the Makumbura Multimodal Transport Center, under the patronage of the Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation, Bimal Rathnayake.

title: Retired War Heroes stage protest at Parliament Roundabout
byline: A group of retired war heroes staged a protest at Polduwa Junction, near the Parliament Roundabout, today (24).

title: ‘Wicked: For Good’ opens to a record $150 million
byline: “Wicked: For Good” brought in $150 million in the U.S. and Canada in its opening weekend, setting a record for a film adaptation of a Broadway musical and ranking among the best-performing movie musicals of all time, according to the studio.

title: Sri Lanka Parliament observes global movement to end gender-based violence
byline: The Women Parliamentarians’ Caucus today (24) arranged for members of Parliament to wear official badges symbolizing the global campaign to mark the 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence 2025.

title: CCTV systems to be compulsory on school vans from next year - Minister
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways and Urban Development, Bimal Rathnayake, stated that CCTV systems will be made mandatory for all school vans.

title: Resigned Miss Universe 2025 judge calls Miss Mexico ‘fake winner’, alleges rigging
byline: The newly crowned Miss Universe, Fatima Bosch of Mexico, is facing calls for her immediate resignation following allegations of undisclosed financial ties between her family and the pageant’s leadership.

title: Veteran Indian actor Dharmendra passes away at 89
byline: The veteran Indian actor, affectionately known as Bollywood’s He-Man and Dharam Paaji, passed away earlier today at the age of 89. His passing leaves behind an unmatched legacy of over six decades.

title: Israel kills top Hezbollah official in first attack on Beirut in months
byline: Israel’s military has killed a senior member of the militant group Hezbollah in an air strike on the southern suburbs of the Lebanese capital, Beirut, despite a ceasefire.

title: Actress Gayathri Dias appears before CID
byline: Popular actress Gayathri Dias appeared before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (24) to record a statement.

title: NPP-held Kandaketiya PS budget defeated for second time
byline: The 2026 budget of the Kandaketiya Pradeshiya Sabha, which is controlled by the National People’s Power (NPP), was defeated for the second time this morning (24).

title: Pedestrian killed after being hit by van on Habarana – Batticaloa road
byline: An individual has died in a road accident along the Habarana – Batticaloa road in Polonnaruwa.

title: Canada, India agree to restart trade talks, says Indian government
byline: Canada and India have agreed to restart stalled talks for a new trade deal, the Indian government said, after discussions between the two countries paused following a diplomatic spat two years ago.

title: Summoning Chief Editor of ‘Aruna’ newspaper to CID undermines media freedom - FMM
byline: The Free Media Movement (FMM) has condemned the summoning of the Chief Editor of the Aruna newspaper, Mahinda Ileperuma, to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to record a statement regarding a news article published in the paper.

title: 2019 Easter Attacks: Case against Hemasiri, Pujith to be taken up once again in Jan. 2026
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Attorney General against former Secretary to the Ministry of Defence Hemasiri Fernando and former IGP Pujith Jayasundara, who are accused of criminal negligence and failure to prevent the Easter Sunday attacks, be taken up again on January 26, 2026.

title: Former Army Captain and driver acquitted over 2001 Wellawatta jewelry store robbery
byline: The Colombo High Court has acquitted and released a former Sri Lanka Army Captain and his personal driver, who were accused of robbing a mobile phone worth Rs. 20,000 from a jewelry store in Wellawatta in 2001.

title: Delhi’s air quality deteriorates, inches closer to ‘severe’ zone
byline: The air quality in Delhi and its surrounding areas turned hazardous on Monday, with a thick blanket of smog engulfing several areas in the Indian capital city.

title: 10 dead, over 500 families affected by adverse weather in recent days
byline: A total of 1,790 individuals from 504 families in 10 districts have been affected by prevailing adverse weather conditions in the country.

title: Massive fire erupts at mattress factory in Panadura
byline: A fire has broken out at a factory producing mattresses in Hirana, Panadura, police stated.

title: FM sends condolences to Vietnam after deadly floods
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath has expressed his deep sorrow over the tragic loss of life caused by severe flooding in central Vietnam in recent days.

title: Embilipitiya HC sentences 10 persons to death over murder charges
byline: The Embilipitiya High Court (HC) has sentenced ten people to death after they were found guilty of murder, police said.

title: IMF to evaluate Sri Lanka’s fifth review on Dec. 15
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) is scheduled to meet on December 15, 2025 to discuss and approve the fifth review of Sri Lanka’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF) programme.

title: Landslide in Haldummulla disrupts traffic flow along Badulla–Colombo Main road
byline: A landslide has occurred in Haldummulla along the Badulla–Colombo main road.

title: Israeli military sacks several generals over Oct 7 attack
byline: Israel’s military announced the dismissal of three generals and disciplinary actions against several other senior officers over their failure to prevent the October 2023 assault by Hamas, the deadliest attack in the country’s history.

title: Atmospheric disturbance in the vicinity of Sri Lanka likely to develop into a low-pressure system
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance in the vicinity of Sri Lanka is likely to develop into a low-pressure system by tomorrow (25), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Canadian PM Carney to visit India next year
byline: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney accepted Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s invitation to visit India following bilateral talks between the two leaders on the sidelines of the G20 summit in South Africa.

title: GMOA sets 48-hour deadline for authorities to provide solutions
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to give 48 hours to authorities to announce solutions to the issues faced by medical professionals and the healthcare system.

title: Sri Lanka Working Journalists’ Association calls to unite against attempts to suppress media
byline: The Sri Lanka Working Journalists’ Association has criticized the summoning of the Editor-in-Chief of the Aruna newspaper, Mahinda Ileperuma, to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) today (24), following a news report published in the paper.

title: Reggae legend Jimmy Cliff dies, aged 81
byline: Jimmy Cliff, one of the most prominent and beloved proponents of reggae music, has died at the age of 81.

title: Landslide warnings issued for residents of 12 districts extended
byline: Early landslide warnings issued to residents of multiple areas in 12 districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island, have been extended.

title: Individual arrested over the removal of signboards at archaeological sites in Batticaloa
byline: An individual has been arrested in connection with the removal of signboards at archaeological sites in the Batticaloa District, according to the Police Media Division.

title: Record US Black Friday crowds to find fewer bargains amid high prices
byline: A landslide has occurred in Haldummulla along the Badulla–Colombo main road.

title: FM tells Canada Govt. to prevent activities that promote separatist ideologies in Sri Lanka
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs Vijitha Herath today (24) held discussions with the High Commissioner of Canada in Colombo, Isabelle Catherine Martin.

title: Zelensky warns against giving away territory as latest Ukraine talks end
byline: Talks in Geneva between the US and Ukraine aimed at ending the war with Russia have concluded, with officials from both sides reporting “progress” and an intention to continue working.

title: Landslide in Haldummulla disrupts traffic on Badulla–Colombo Road
byline: A landslide has occurred between Beragala and Haldummulla within the Haldummulla Police Division.
